org.kynosarges.tektosyne

Class MathUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kynosarges.tektosyne.MathUtils

  • public final class MathUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides general mathematical utility methods.

    • Method Detail

      • compare

        public static int compare(double a,
                          double b,
                          double epsilon)
        Compares two Double numbers numerically, given the specified epsilon.
        Parameters:
        a - the first Double number to compare
        b - the second Double number to compare
        epsilon - the maximum absolute difference where a and b are considered equal
        Returns:
        zero if the absolute difference between a and b is no greater than epsilon, otherwise a value less or greater than zero if a is less or greater than b, respectively
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if epsilon is less than zero

      • compare

        public static int compare(float a,
                          float b,
                          float epsilon)
        Compares two Float numbers numerically, given the specified epsilon.
        Parameters:
        a - the first Float number to compare
        b - the second Float number to compare
        epsilon - the maximum absolute difference where a and b are considered equal
        Returns:
        zero if the absolute difference between a and b is no greater than epsilon, otherwise a value less or greater than zero if a is less or greater than b, respectively
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if epsilon is less than zero

      • equals

        public static boolean equals(double a,
                             double b,
                             double epsilon)
        Compares two Double numbers for equality, given the specified epsilon.
        Parameters:
        a - the first Double number to compare
        b - the second Double number to compare
        epsilon - the maximum absolute difference where a and b are considered equal
        Returns:
        true if the absolute difference between a and b is no greater than epsilon, else false
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if epsilon is less than zero

      • equals

        public static boolean equals(float a,
                             float b,
                             float epsilon)
        Compares two Float numbers for equality, given the specified epsilon.
        Parameters:
        a - the first Float number to compare
        b - the second Float number to compare
        epsilon - the maximum absolute difference where a and b are considered equal
        Returns:
        true if the absolute difference between a and b is no greater than epsilon, else false
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if epsilon is less than zero

      • getAny

        public static <T> T getAny(T[] array)
        Gets a random element from the specified array. Returns the array element at a random index between zero (inclusive) and length (exclusive). This is an O(1) operation.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of all elements in the array
        Parameters:
        array - the array providing the elements
        Returns:
        a random element from array
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if array is empty
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if array is null

      • getAny

        public static <T> T getAny(java.util.Collection<T> collection)
        Gets a random element from the specified Collection. Iterates through collection for a random number of steps, between zero (inclusive) to Collection.size() (exclusive). This is an O(n) operation.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of all elements in the Collection
        Parameters:
        collection - the Collection providing the elements
        Returns:
        a random element from collection
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if collection is empty
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if collection is null

      • getAny

        public static <T> T getAny(java.util.List<T> list)
        Gets a random element from the specified List. Returns the list element at a random index between zero (inclusive) and List.size() (exclusive). This is usually an O(1) operation.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of all elements in the List
        Parameters:
        list - the List providing the elements
        Returns:
        a random element from list
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if list is empty
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if list is null

      • isPrime

        public static boolean isPrime(int candidate)
        Determines whether the specified Integer number is prime. Performs trial divisions of the specified candidate against any number between two and the square root of candidate.
        Parameters:
        candidate - the Integer number to examine
        Returns:
        true if candidate is prime, else false
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if candidate is not positive

      • normalize

        public static double normalize(double[] array)
        Normalizes the specified array of non-negative Double numbers. Divides all array elements by the sum of all elements (which is also returned), thus normalizing their values to a partitioning of the standard interval [0, 1]. If the sum of all elements is zero, all elements are instead set to 1.0/length where length is the number of array elements.
        Parameters:
        array - the array of non-negative Double numbers to normalize
        Returns:
        the sum of all array elements before normalization
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if array is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if array contains a negative number

      • normalize

        public static float normalize(float[] array)
        Normalizes the specified array of non-negative Float numbers. Divides all array elements by the sum of all elements (which is also returned), thus normalizing their values to a partitioning of the standard interval [0, 1]. If the sum of all elements is zero, all elements are instead set to 1f/length where length is the number of array elements.
        Parameters:
        array - the array of non-negative Float numbers to normalize
        Returns:
        the sum of all array elements before normalization
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if array is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if array contains a negative number

      • restrict

        public static double restrict(double a,
                              double min,
                              double max)
        Restricts the specified Double number to the specified range.
        Parameters:
        a - the Double number to restrict
        min - the smallest permissible Double value for a
        max - the greatest permissible Double value for a
        Returns:
        min or max if a is less or greater than min or max, respectively, otherwise a itself

      • restrict

        Returns:
